instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3299: What is 820-3299? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Disableing dedicated grapic on Imac <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3299</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Is there a guide on how to disable the dedicated grapic chip on newer  (4k / 5k) Imacs?
for example <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3299</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has the same Gmux chip as the 15 inch retina macbooks.
I believe its possible.
has someone done this already?
